name: block stitch chunky hat
sizes_available: newborn (baby, toddler, child) (teen, adult, large adult)
notes:
the **block stitch chunky crochet hat** is a perfect project for beginners and seasoned crocheters alike! made with warm and dense aran weight yarn, this cozy hat works up quickly in *joined and turned rounds* using simple *double crochet and single crochet* stitches—making it an easy yet satisfying make. the block stitch, a slight variation of the classic granny stitch, adds beautiful texture and a timeless look while remaining effortless to master. whether you're making one for yourself or as a thoughtful handmade gift, this hat is perfect for everyone, with *seven sizes included* in the pattern to fit all ages. quick, stylish, and beginner-friendly, it’s a must-have for chilly days!

we'll begin by crocheting the brim in rows, then join it to work the body in the round with alternating colors (carrying them up inside the hat for fewer ends to weave in), finishing with decreases at the top. add a pompom if desired, and you’re done!


crochet hook: 
[g+ (4.5mm) & h (5.0mm) - or size to meet gauge][1]

notions:
[removable stitch marker][2]
[yarn needle to weave in ends][3]
[scissors][4]

yarn:
[muse aran][5]
100% superwash merino wool,- 114yds/100g

[muse aran bare][6]
100% superwash merino wool, 114yds/100g

yardage:
80-180 total yds
color a: 70 (85, 105) (125, 140, 155) yds
color b: 10 (15, 15) (20, 20, 25) yds

yarn substitutions:
[malabrigo washted][7]
100% superwash merino wool, 210yds/100g

[wecrochet twill][8]
100% superwash merino wool, 149yds/100g

abbreviations:
blo - back loop only
ch(s) - chain(s)
dc - double crochet
dc2tog - double crochet 2 together
rs - right side
sc - single crochet
sl st - slip stitch
st(s) - stitch(es)
stsc - [stacked single crochet][9]
ws - wrong side

gauge:
16 sts and 11 rows = 4" by 4"  in stitch pattern repeat (see gauge swatch instructions), not blocked.

not sure what gauge is? check out this blog post: [what is crochet gauge and how to fix it][10]

sizes:
newborn (baby, toddler, child) (teen, adult, large adult)
to fit head circumference: 
newborn: 13-14”; baby: 15-16”; toddler: 17-18”; child: 19-20”; teen: 21-22"; adult: 22-23”; large adult: 24-25”

skill level:
advanced beginner
